poem:
Title: The Orcas of Hokkaido

In the heart's cold murmuring
A tale of trapped whales unfolds,
Beneath the cruel carving of ice.
A Dance of shadow and light, 
In Hokkaido's frosty boldness.
Spectral in their despair,
The sea's chiseled prisoners sing.
Resonate, their plea, in the lonely winter,
In man's reluctant ear.
One kilometer from salvation,
Ten dark eyes pierce the pallid surface,
Yearning for freedom's forgotten embrace.
